# build: reduce build and test logging

Reduced verbose logging during build and test execution. Verbose output is now collected and only printed on error.

## Changes

- **3p/nvim-parsers/install.lua**: Collect verbose output in log buffer, only print on error. On success, print formatted summary with parser count
- **3p/nvim-parsers/cook.mk**: Simplified to just invoke install.lua with target path
- **Makefile**: Remove verbose test execution logging

## Details

Previously, nvim-parsers printed 7+ lines of diagnostic output on every build, and tests printed execution details for every test file. This cluttered build output and made it hard to spot actual issues.

The new approach:
- Collects all verbose output in a buffer
- On error: dumps full log for debugging
- On success: prints concise summary with key metrics

## Results

Before:
```
nvim-parsers: building o/nvim-parsers/.parsers from o/nvim/.staged
nvim-parsers: nvim_bin=o/nvim/.staged/bin/nvim
nvim-parsers: treesitter_staged=o/nvim-treesitter/.staged
nvim-parsers: output_dir=o/nvim-parsers
nvim-parsers: parsers_config=o/.config/nvim/parsers.lua
nvim-parsers: tree_sitter_staged=o/tree-sitter/.staged
nvim-parsers: nvim is executable
...
test: 3p/luacheck/test_luacheck.lua -> o/3p/luacheck/test_luacheck.lua.tested (TEST_DIR=o/luacheck/.staged)
```

After:
```
âœ“ BUILD  o/nvim-parsers/.parsers (nvim-parsers: 10 parsers built)
```
(tests run silently unless they fail)

## Validation

- [x] Build succeeds and shows concise output
- [x] Parser count is correctly displayed (10 parsers)
- [x] Verbose logs still available on error
- [x] Tests run silently on success
